alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 27 at 8:57AM PDT until October 28 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...FROST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 possible tonight into tomorrow morning. The current Freeze Warning and Frost Advisory this morning will expire as temperatures are warming. * WHERE...Central Douglas County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
